faq.question: What is the shipping policy for multiple addresses
faq.answer: Each order can be shipped only to a single address, specified at the time of payment. If you wish to ship products to different addresses, you need to place multiple orders.

faq.answer: We make our best effort to ship each item in your order within 3 working days of the order date. However, it may take up to 5 or more working days during festivals, sales, or due to other mitigating circumstances.

faq.question: What should I do if my order arrives damaged
faq.answer: If your order arrives visibly damaged, please contact Gizmore Customer Service immediately with your order ID and images of the product. Gizmore will dispatch a replacement or initiate a refund immediately.

faq.question: How are vulnerabilities in the firmware identified
faq.answer: Vulnerabilities are identified by feedback from customers, users, and through our internal security assessments. We also hold immediate security review meetings upon identification to devise solutions.

faq.question: vulnerabilities in the firmware
faq.answer: Vulnerabilities are identified by feedback from customers, users, and through our internal security assessments. We also hold immediate security review meetings upon identification to devise solutions.

faq.question: How are vulnerabilities in firmware identified
faq.answer: Vulnerabilities are identified by feedback from customers, users, and through our internal security assessments. We also hold immediate security review meetings upon identification to devise solutions.

faq.question: What steps are taken when a vulnerability is found
faq.answer: Upon identifying a vulnerability, a security review meeting is conducted with key personnel, including the project development manager and Technical Director, to propose a solution. This is followed by specific implementation by developers, code review, firmware update, QA testing, and finally, OTA updates for projects.

faq.question: steps taken when a vulnerability is found
faq.answer: Upon identifying a vulnerability, a security review meeting is conducted with key personnel, including the project development manager and Technical Director, to propose a solution. faq.answer: Upon identifying a vulnerability, a security review meeting is conducted with key personnel, including the project development manager and Technical Director, to propose a solution. faq.answer: The process involves multiple stakeholders including project development managers, the Technical Director, firmware developers, security technology managers, project developers, and the QA team.

faq.question: How do you assess and prioritize vulnerabilities
faq.answer: We use the CVSSv2 standard as a reference for assessing and prioritizing the severity of vulnerabilities, ensuring that we address the most critical issues promptly.

faq.answer: We use the CVSSv2 standard as a reference for assessing and prioritizing the severity of vulnerabilities, ensuring that we address the most critical issues promptly.

faq.question: What happens if issues are found with the updated firmware?
faq.answer: If the QA team identifies problems with the updated firmware, the development process cycles back to the implementation stage for further refinement until the firmware passes quality assurance testing.

faq.question: What is OTA and how does it work
faq.answer: OTA (Over-The-Air) technology allows us to remotely update the firmware on devices without needing physical access. This process ensures your device is up-to-date with the latest features and security improvements.

faq.question: Is there any cost for repairing a device under warranty
faq.answer: Repairs for devices under warranty are typically free of charge, excluding any physical or liquid damage. Please bring your proof of purchase when visiting the service center.

faq.question: Can I contact a service center directly for support
faq.answer: Yes, you can contact any of our service centers directly using the provided phone numbers or email addresses for support and inquiries.
